required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Duration of LASTACAFT® in Acute Allergic Conjunctivitis

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the duration of action of LASTACAFT® and Pataday™ as compared to artificial tears (placebo) in the prevention of ocular itching associated with allergic conjunctivitis.

primary_outcome.measure: Ocular Itching Evaluated by the Subject at 3, 5, and 7 Minutes Post Challenge on Day 0 at Hour 16
primary_outcome.description: Ocular itching evaluated by the subject at 3, 5, and 7 minutes post challenge on Day 0 (Visit 3) at hour 16. Subjects scored their ocular itching on a numeric analog scale ranging from 0=None to 4=Incapacitating Itch with an Irresistible Urge to Rub (0.5 increments were allowed). For each subject, the score for both eyes was averaged (i.e., one score per subject). A lower score was indicative of less itching.

primary_outcome.measure: Ocular Itching Evaluated by the Subject at 3, 5, and 7 Minutes Post Challenge on Day 14 at Hour 24
primary_outcome.description: Ocular itching evaluated by the subject at 3, 5, and 7 minutes post challenge on Day 14 (Visit 4) at hour 24. Subjects scored their ocular itching on a numeric analog scale ranging from 0=None to 4=Incapacitating Itch with an Irresistible Urge to Rub (0.5 increments were allowed). For each subject, the score for both eyes was averaged (i.e., one score per subject). A lower score was indicative of less itching.

secondary_outcome.measure: Conjunctival Redness Evaluated by the Investigator at 7, 15, and 20 Minutes Post Challenge on Day 14 at Hour 24
secondary_outcome.description: Conjunctival redness evaluated by the investigator at 7, 15, and 20 minutes post challenge on Day 14 (Visit 4) at hour 24. Investigators scored conjunctival redness on a numeric analog scale ranging from 0=None to 4=Extremely Severe (0.5 increments were allowed). For each subject, the score for both eyes was averaged (i.e., one score per subject). A lower score was indicative of less conjunctival redness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ciliary Redness Evaluated by the Investigator at 7, 15, and 20 Minutes Post Challenge on Day 14 at Hour 24
secondary_outcome.description: Ciliary redness evaluated by the investigator at 7, 15, and 20 minutes post challenge on Day 14 (Visit 4) at hour 24. Investigators scored ciliary redness on a numeric analog scale ranging from 0=None to 4=Extremely Severe (0.5 increments were allowed). For each subject, the score for both eyes was averaged (i.e., one score per subject). A lower score was indicative of less ciliary redness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Episcleral Redness Evaluated by the Investigator at 7, 15, and 20 Minutes Post Challenge on Day 14 at Hour 24
secondary_outcome.description: Episcleral redness evaluated by the investigator at 7, 15, and 20 minutes post challenge on Day 14 (Visit 4) at hour 24. Investigators scored episcleral redness on a numeric analog scale ranging from 0=None to 4=Extremely Severe (0.5 increments were allowed). For each subject, the score for both eyes was averaged (i.e., one score per subject). A lower score was indicative of less episcleral redness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Chemosis Evaluated by the Investigator at 7, 15, and 20 Minutes Post Challenge on Day 14 at Hour 24
secondary_outcome.description: Chemosis evaluated by the investigator at 7, 15, and 20 minutes post challenge on Day 14 (Visit 4) at hour 24. Investigators scored chemosis on a numeric analog scale ranging from 0=None to 4=Severe (0.5 increments were allowed). For each subject, the score for both eyes was averaged (i.e., one score per subject). A lower score was indicative of less chemosis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Eyelid Swelling Evaluated by the Subject at 7, 15, and 20 Minutes Post Challenge on Day 14 at Hour 24
secondary_outcome.description: Eyelid swelling evaluated by the subject at 7, 15, and 20 minutes post challenge on Day 14 (Visit 4) at hour 24. Subjects scored eyelid swelling on a numeric analog 4-point scale ranging from 0=None to 3=Severe. For each subject, the score for both eyes was averaged (i.e., one score per subject). A lower score was indicative of less lid swelling.

secondary_outcome.measure: Tearing Evaluated by the Subject at 7, 15, and 20 Minutes Post Challenge on Day 14 at Hour 24
secondary_outcome.description: Tearing evaluated by the subject at 7, 15, and 20 minutes post challenge on Day 14 (Visit 4) at hour 24. Subjects scored tearing on a 5-point numeric analog scale ranging from 0=None/Normal to 4=Very Severe. For each subject, the score for both eyes was averaged (i.e., one score per subject). A lower score was indicative of less tearing.

arm_group.description: One drop of alcaftadine 0.25% ophthalmic solution instilled in each eye at Day 0 and Day 14.
One drop of olopatadine 0.2% ophthalmic solution instilled in each eye at Day 0 and Day 14.
One drop of placebo instilled in each eye at Day 0 and Day 14.

intervention.description: One drop of alcaftadine 0.25% ophthalmic solution instilled in each eye at Day 0 and Day 14.
One drop of olopatadine 0.2% ophthalmic solution instilled in each eye at Day 0 and Day 14.
One drop of placebo instilled in each eye at Day 0 and Day 14.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- History of eye allergies within the past 24 months
- Willing to not wear contact lenses at least 72 hours prior to the study start and during the study period
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current eye infection
- Eye surgery within 3 months or vision correction surgery within 6 months
- Any planned surgery during the study or 30 days after the study

group.title: LASTACAFT® (Alcaftadine 0.25%)
group.description: One drop of alcaftadine 0.25% ophthalmic solution instilled in each eye at Day 0 and Day 14.

group.title: Pataday™ (Olopatadine 0.2%)
group.description: One drop of olopatadine 0.2% ophthalmic solution instilled in each eye at Day 0 and Day 14.

group.title: Placebo (Dextran 70 0.1%/Hydroxypropyl Methylcellulose 0.3%)
group.description: One drop of placebo instilled in each eye at Day 0 and Day 14.

group.description: One drop of alcaftadine 0.25% ophthalmic solution instilled in each eye at Day 0 and Day 14.

reported_events.desc: The Safety Population was defined as all randomized subjects who received at least one dose of study treatment and was used to assess adverse events (AEs) and serious adverse events (SAEs).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo
